item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"Sonnet XVII
I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz, or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off. I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul.
I love you as the plant that never blooms but carries in itself the light of hidden flowers; thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance, risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.
I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride; so I love you because I know no other way than this:
where I does not exist, nor you, so close that your hand on my chest is my hand, so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep. " -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "You can't doubt so much, Psyche" -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Fairies have to be one thing or the other, because being so small they unfortunately have room for one feeling only at a time." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description:
"She asked where he lived.
Second to the right,' said Peter, 'and then straight on till morning." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "The last thing he ever said to me was, 'Just always be waiting for me, and then some night you will hear me crowing." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by J.M. Barrie
Faith Jessica add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "All the world is made of faith, and trust, and pixie dust." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I hate to hear you talk about all women as if they were fine ladies instead of rational creatures. None of us want to be in calm waters all our lives." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Eva Ibbotson
item.description: "This is worse than Hollywood, he thought. A girl comes in with a pork chop and I write a song for her." -- Eva Ibbotson

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Wish on everything. Pink cars are good, especially old ones. And stars of course, first stars and shooting stars. Planes will do if they are the first light in the sky and look like stars. Wish in tunnels, holding your breath and lifting your feet off the ground. Birthday candles. Baby teeth." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Everything was chocolate ice cream and kisses and wind." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and Iâ€” I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Poetry is what gets lost in translation." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Eva Ibbotson
item.description: "Well, dear, it's true that adventures are good for people even when they are very young. Adventures can get into a person's blood even if he doesn't remember having them." -- Eva Ibbotson

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Eva Ibbotson
item.description: "Herr Altenburg, I can't; I have vertigo.' And Marek looked at him: 'All right - I'll get the chemist to fix me something." -- Eva Ibbotson

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I have great faith in fools - self-confidence my friends will call it." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I wish I could write as mysterious as a cat." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Science has not yet taught us if madness is or is not the sublimity of the intelligence." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Deep in earth my love is lying And I must weep alone." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Magic can be found in stolen moments." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "But be careful; sand is already broken but glass breaks. The shoes are for dancing, not running away." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Morning. Strawberry sky dusted with white winter powder sugar sun. And nobody to munch on it with" -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Alan Lightman
item.description: "If a person holds no ambitions in this world, he suffers unknowingly. If a person holds ambitions, he suffers knowingly, but very slowly." -- Alan Lightman

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Alan Lightman
item.description: "Each person who gets stuck in time gets stuck alone." -- Alan Lightman

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Someday, somewhere - anywhere, unfailingly, you'll find yourself, and that, and only that, can be the happiest or bitterest hour of your life." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Clamp
item.description: "There is no such thing as coincidence, only hitsuzen." -- Clamp

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by clamp
item.description: "Kurogane, to Fai: You, shut up!! If you want to die that much, I'll kill you myself! But until that day, you're going to live!" -- clamp

item.title: Faith Jessica add a quote by Clamp
item.description: "Kurogane: That's what you want, isn't it? Underneath that constant grin, you're keeping everyone away. So that nobody gets involved with you. But look. Just now you checked to see if the kid had a fever, and you're relieved that the princess doesn't see the wretched condition of this world. And in the last country, you used your magic. Fai: *smiling* I said it, didn't I? I wasn't going to die. And so... Kurogane: Yeah, but that was all about you not dying on your own account. Dying for somebody else... That's a whole new question. Back then, if you hadn't done anything, we would have been captured, and if we handled it wrong, we might have died. But you decided to use magic on your own. <i>You involved yourself in their lives.</i> Fai: *no longer smiling, looks depressed* I... I don't want to make anyone unhappy because of their involvement with me. " -- Clamp
